events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway at approximately 7 AM.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident as it involves damage to the insured vehicle from a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to assist the customer with their vehicle accident claim.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the customer received confirmation and initial guidance.
Requested police report, photos of vehicle damage, and witness statements for further investigation.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report and detailed photos of the car damage.
Investigation began to assess liability and extent of vehicle damage following the submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault and damage estimates were verified.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to cover the full repairs and associated rental car costs.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt and transparent communication during the claim process.
Claim was approved for the proposed settlement amount ensuring full repair coverage without deductible.
Payment was promptly issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop to begin vehicle repairs as scheduled.
Claim was officially closed after all payments made and repair confirmation received from service provider.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely for future reference if needed.
